designScenario.name: Elevators
designScenario.description: The Elevators system is a primary flight control surface responsible for aircraft pitch modulation via deflection adjustments. Integrated with fly-by-wire systems, it translates electronic commands from the Flight Control Computer into aerodynamic forces. The design emphasizes ultra-responsive actuation, fault-tolerant redundancy, adaptive load compensation, and real-time health monitoring. Constructed with advanced composites, the system operates in extreme environmental conditions while maintaining precise control authority during high-stress maneuvers such as takeoff, turbulence, and landing.

details.description: Convert digital flight control commands into calibrated hydraulic/pneumatic actuator movements for elevator deflection.
Adjust deflection angles in real time using aerodynamic load and airspeed data to optimize control surface effectiveness.
Achieve actuation response time ≤40 ms from command input to full deflection at cruise aerodynamic loads.
Maintain angular positioning accuracy of ±0.05° under vibrational loads up to 15G.
Implement cross-monitored primary and backup actuation channels with automatic failover during hydraulic/electrical faults.
Engage mechanical lock mechanism to stabilize elevators in neutral position upon critical system failure.
Integrate strain gauges and wear sensors to predict component fatigue and schedule proactive maintenance.
Use corrosion-resistant titanium alloys for hinge mechanisms to ensure 50,000+ flight cycle lifespan.

systemComponents.name: Elevators
systemComponents.description: Dual-panel horizontal stabilizers providing pitch control authority through symmetric or asymmetric deflection.

subComponents.name: Left Elevator Panel
subComponents.description: Portside control surface with carbon-fiber composite core and anti-icing conductive layers.

subComponents.name: Right Elevator Panel
subComponents.description: Starboard control surface mirroring left panel's construction, synchronized via control linkage.

subComponents.name: Electro-Hydraulic Actuator Assembly
subComponents.description: Dual-redundant servo actuators converting electrical signals into mechanical force via closed-loop hydraulic pressure.

subComponents.name: Position Feedback Encoder
subComponents.description: Fault-tolerant resolver-based sensors providing real-time deflection angle measurement to 0.01° resolution.

subComponents.name: Elevator Control Unit (ECU)
subComponents.description: Triple-redundant microprocessor managing actuator commands, surface synchronization, and fault detection.

relationships.description: Transmits real-time pitch control commands and receives health status data via ARINC 429 digital bus.
Integral sub-system within the aircraft's complete flight control surface architecture.
Actuators rely on encoder feedback for closed-loop position control and oscillation damping.
Provides backup power during electrical failures to maintain minimal pitch control capability.

attributes.name: actuationResponseTime
attributes.description: Maximum latency from control input to 95% of commanded elevator deflection at 500kt airspeed.

attributes.name: deflectionPrecision
attributes.description: Angular positioning accuracy maintained across -50°C to +70°C operational temperature range.

attributes.name: materialStrength
attributes.value: Carbon-fiber reinforced polymer with 2200 MPa tensile strength
attributes.description: Composite structure rated for 2.5x maximum expected aerodynamic loads with fatigue life ≥100,000 cycles.

attributes.name: environmentResistance
attributes.description: Operational capability in extreme weather with erosion-resistant leading edge treatment.

attributes.name: loadTolerance
attributes.description: Maximum torsional load capacity during high-speed maneuvers with safety factor of 1.5.

attributes.name: operationalLifespan
attributes.description: Mean time between functional failures assuming scheduled maintenance per MRO guidelines.
